recipes.name: Irish Spiced Beef
recipes.description: A really nice beef brisket that is nicely spiced from Ireland.
instruction: 1. Place beef in a 15x10x1-in. baking pan; rub with brown sugar. Refrigerate, covered, 24 hours.
2. In a small bowl, mix salt, chopped onion, bay leaves, and seasonings; rub over beef. Refrigerate, covered, 3 days, turning and rubbing salt mixture into beef once each day.

3. Preheat oven to 325°. Remove and discard salt mixture. Place beef, onions, carrots, celery, and stout in a roasting pan. Add water to come halfway up the brisket. Roast, covered, 4–4½ hours or until meat is tender. Cool meat in cooking juices for 1 hour.
4. Remove beef; discard vegetables and cooking juices. Transfer beef to a 13x9-in. baking dish. Refrigerate, covered, overnight.
5. Cut diagonally across the grain into thin slices. Serve with rye bread, cheese, and mustard.

recipes.name: Scottish Oatmeal Rolls
recipes.description: Some round oatmeal rolls for a scottish touch.
instruction: 1. In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil; add oats and butter. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat; cool to lukewarm.
2. In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Add the oat mixture, sugars, salt, and 4 cups flour; beat until smooth. Add enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.
3. Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, 6–8 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
4. Punch dough down; allow to rest for 10 minutes. Shape into 18 balls. Place in 2 greased 9-in. round baking pans. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes.
5. Preheat oven to 350°; bake rolls until golden brown, 20–25 minutes. Remove from pans to wire racks.

recipes.name: Almond Tea Bread
recipes.description: A recipe from an individual in scotland, each bread has red cherries.
ingredients: 1-1/2 cups fresh pitted cherries or blueberries
instruction: 1. In a large bowl, combine almond paste and butter; beat until well blended. Gradually add sugar, beating until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
2. In a small bowl, gently toss cherries and 1 tablespoon flour. Set aside.
3. Combine the baking powder, salt, and remaining flour; add to the creamed mixture alternately with milk, beating well after each addition.

4. Spoon a sixth of the batter into each of two greased and floured 8x4-in. loaf pans; sprinkle layers with half of the fruit. Cover with another layer of batter and sprinkle with remaining fruit. Top with remaining batter; smooth with spatula.
5. Bake at 350° until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1¼ hours. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks.

recipes.name: English Rhubarb Crumble
recipes.description: A different take for a crumble.
instruction: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a bowl, stir together the rhubarb, apples, and strawberries.
2. Spoon the mixture into a greased 8-inch square baking dish. In a separate bowl, stir together the sugar and cinnamon. Evenly sprinkle the sugar mixture over the rhubarb mixture, and set aside.
3. In a bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt.
4. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
5. Stir in the brown sugar and quick-cooking oats.
6. Sprinkle the crumble topping over the rhubarb mixture.
7. Bake the rhubarb crumble until it’s lightly browned, 40–50 minutes. Serve the rhubarb warm or chilled with a scoop of ice cream if desired.

recipes.name: Crispy Fish & Chips
recipes.description: A different version of fish and chips when you introduce horseradish and worcestershire.
instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 450°. Arrange steak fries in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake on lowest oven rack 18–20 minutes or until light golden brown.

2. Meanwhile, place salmon on a foil-lined baking sheet coated with cooking spray. In a small bowl, mix horseradish, cheese, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and salt; stir in panko. Press mixture onto fillets. Spritz tops with cooking spray.
3. Bake salmon on middle oven rack 8–10 minutes or until fish just begins to flake easily with a fork. Serve with fries.

recipes.name: Potato Dumplings
recipes.description: A german variant of potato dumplings.
instruction: 1. Place the potatoes in a Dutch oven or a large, wide pot; add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, and cook, uncovered, 15 to 20 minutes or until tender.
2. Pour the potatoes into a colander to drain completely, then transfer them to a large bowl. Use a potato masher or ricer to mash the potatoes just until loose and fluffy.

3. Stir the flour, eggs, dry bread crumbs, salt and nutmeg into the mashed potatoes. Divide the dough evenly into 16 balls (about 2 inches in diameter), then roll each one between your palms, firmly shaping until a smooth ball forms and holds together.

4. In a Dutch oven, bring 12 cups water to a boil. Using a slotted spoon, carefully add the dumplings. Reduce the heat, and simmer, uncovered, seven to nine minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center of the dumplings comes out clean.

recipes.name: Apfelkuchen
recipes.description: A german recipe for apple cake.
instruction: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Before starting anything else, let the egg yolks stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.

2. Place the softened butter and granulated sugar in a large mixing bowl. Use a hand mixer or stand mixer to cream them until light and fluffy. This will take five to seven minutes on medium-high speed.

3. Grab your sifter and sift together the flour, cornstarch, cream of tartar, baking powder, and salt. Once you’re done sifting, sift again. Slowly add the flour mixture into the creamed mixture. Beat until just combined, then add the milk.

4. (Grab your 9-inch springform pan and wrap the exterior with a sheet of foil.) Spritz the interior of the pan with cooking spray. Even if the pan is nonstick, grease it to make removing the cake easier.
5. (Gently press) the fanned apples, round side up, into the batter. Don’t press the apples too far into the batter—a quarter inch will do.
6. (Bake) the cake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with moist crumbs, about 45–55 minutes.

7. (Remove) the apfelkuchen from the oven and let it cool at room temperature on a wire rack. After 10 minutes, run a knife around the inside edge of the pan and remove the foil. Let the cake cool for another hour before removing the springform collar.

recipes.name: Hazelnut French Macarons
recipes.description: The ol classic hazelnut french macarons.
ingredients: Buttercream (butter, confectioners sugar, whipping cream, vanilla extract, salt)
instruction: 1. Use a kitchen scale to measure out the ingredients. Macarons require precise measurements. Pulse the almond flour and 3 tablespoons of confectioners’ sugar together until very fine. Pass the mixture through a fine mesh sieve and discard any large pieces.

2. In a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, add the egg whites and salt to the bowl and whisk on medium-low speed until frothy. Slowly add the superfine sugar, taking about 2 minutes. Whisk until the meringue is glossy and stiff peaks form, about another 2–3 minutes.

3. Add your meringue into a large, wide-mouthed bowl. Fold in about a third of the almond flour mixture into the meringue. Repeat with the remaining almond flour mixture, working slowly to avoid deflating the egg whites.
4. Take a pastry bag fitted with a round tip and pipe the mixture onto a cookie sheet lined with a pastry mat or parchment paper. Pipe circles about 1½–2 inches wide.
5. Tap the cookie sheet on the counter to release any air bubbles. Let them sit to form a shell before baking.

recipes.name: Finnish Salmon and Dill Pie
recipes.description: A shared family recipe of salmon and dill pie.
instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 400°. In a small skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add green onions; cook and stir until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in salmon and dill.
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough to a ⅛-in.-thick circle; transfer to a 9-in. pie plate. Trim crust to ½ in. beyond the rim of the plate; flute edge. Spoon salmon mixture into crust.
3. In a small bowl, whisk eggs, cream, flour, and seasonings until blended; pour over top. Sprinkle with cheese.
4. Bake on a lower oven rack until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, 35–40 minutes. Cover the edge loosely with foil during the last 10 minutes to prevent overbrowning.

recipes.name: Shrimp Mozambique
recipes.description: A recipe passed down in a family in Portuguese culture.
ingredients: 2 pounds uncooked shell-on shrimp (16-20 per pound)
2 envelopes sazon with coriander and annatto
1 bottle (12 ounces) beer or 1-1/2 cups chicken broth
instruction: 1. In an oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, 4–5 minutes. Add garlic and shrimp; cook 1 minute longer. Stir in seasonings.
2. Add beer and lemon juice; bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, until shrimp turn pink, 10–15 minutes. Stir in ketchup and parsley; discard bay leaf.
3. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Portuguese French Toast
recipes.description: A nice sweet french toast from Portugal.
ingredients: 1 loaf (8 ounces) French bread, cut into 1-inch slices
instruction: 1. In a small bowl, mix sugar and cinnamon until blended. In a large shallow dish, whisk eggs and milk. Dip both sides of bread in egg mixture, soaking lightly.

2. In an electric skillet, heat 1 inch of oil to 350°. Working with a few slices at a time, remove bread from egg mixture, allowing excess to drain, and fry 2–3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
3. Dip warm rabanadas in cinnamon-sugar to coat all sides. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Patatas Bravas (Spicy Potatoes)
recipes.description: Spanish comfort food for potatoes.
instruction: 1. Place garlic on a cutting board; sprinkle with salt. Mash garlic with the flat side of the knife blade, forming a smooth paste. Transfer to a small bowl. Whisk in mayonnaise, lemon juice, and oil until smooth. Cover; refrigerate until serving.

2. For bravas sauce, in a small saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, 2–3 minutes. Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer. Stir in flour and paprika until smooth; gradually stir in broth. Add bay leaf. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly; cook and stir until thickened, 6–8 minutes.
3. Remove from heat; cool slightly. Remove and discard bay leaf. Puree sauce using an immersion blender or cool slightly and puree in a blender. Return to pan and heat through. Keep warm.
4. Cut potatoes into 1½-inch cubes; soak in cold water for 30 minutes. Drain potatoes; pat dry with paper towels.
5. In an electric skillet or deep-fat fryer, heat oil to 250°. Fry potatoes until tender, 8–10 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon; drain on paper towels and cool completely.
6. Increase temperature of oil to 375°. Fry potatoes again until crisp and golden brown, 3–4 minutes, turning frequently. Drain on paper towels; sprinkle with salt. Serve with bravas sauce and aioli.

recipes.name: Caramel Apple Strudel
recipes.description: A special recipe coming from a family for a strudel.
ingredients: 5 medium apples, peeled and chopped (5 cups)
1/4 cup fat-free caramel ice cream topping
instruction: 1. Preheat oven to 375°. In a large saucepan, combine the first 6 ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, 15–20 minutes or until apples are tender, stirring occasionally. Cool completely.
2. Unfold puff pastry onto a large sheet of parchment; roll into a 16x12-inch rectangle. Transfer parchment and pastry to a baking sheet, placing a short side of the rectangle facing you.
3. (Using a slotted spoon), arrange apples on the bottom half of the pastry to within 1 inch of edges. Drizzle apples with caramel topping.
4. (Roll up jelly-roll style), starting with the bottom side. Pinch seams to seal and tuck ends under.
5. (In a small bowl), whisk egg with water; brush over pastry. Sprinkle with coarse sugar. Cut slits in the top.
6. (Bake) for 25–30 minutes or until golden brown. If desired, serve with whipped cream and additional caramel topping.

recipes.name: Austrian Walnut Cookies
recipes.description: Known as palatschinkens in Austria, these are nice cookies meant for melting in your mouth.
ingredients: Filling (3 egg whites, 1 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 cup ground walnuts)
instruction: 1. In a large bowl, beat butter until creamy. Beat in egg yolks, 2 at a time. Gradually beat in flour.
2. Divide dough into 3 portions. Shape each into a disk; wrap in plastic. Refrigerate overnight.

3. Preheat oven to 350°. In a small bowl, using clean beaters, beat egg whites on medium speed until foamy. Gradually add confectioners' sugar, 2 tablespoons at a time, beating on high after each addition until sugar is dissolved. Fold in walnuts.

4. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion of dough to ⅛-inch thickness. Cut with a floured 3-inch round cookie cutter. Spread each cookie with 1 teaspoon walnut mixture to within ¼ inch of edges. Fold dough almost in half over filling, allowing filling to show. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets.
5. Bake 8–10 minutes or until light brown. Remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
6. Dust cookies with additional confectioner's sugar. Store in airtight containers in the refrigerator.

recipes.name: Chicken Yakitori
recipes.description: A Japanese delicacy for grilled skewers.
instruction: 1. In a small saucepan, stir together the mirin, sake, soy sauce, and sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then pull the pan off the burner. Set aside half of this sauce for dipping; the rest will be used to baste the chicken.

2. Thread the peppers evenly onto 2 metal or soaked wooden skewers. Thread the chicken pieces separately onto 6 metal or soaked wooden skewers. Heat the grill to medium, and have the basting sauce and a brush ready next to the grill.

3. Arrange the chicken skewers on the grill grates, and grill, covered, until the meat is cooked through, 10–12 minutes, turning the chicken skewers while they cook and basting frequently, especially during the final three minutes of cook time. Grill the peppers, covered, until they’re tender, 4–5 minutes, giving them an occasional turn. At the end, grill the green onions for 1–2 minutes, until they’re slightly charred and tender. Serve the chicken and vegetables with the reserved sauce for dipping.

recipes.name: Curried Beef Stew
recipes.description: A beef stew recipe that an individual created in memories of their mother back in Japan.
ingredients: 3/4 pound beef stew meat (1- to 1-1/2-inch pieces)
1-1/2 pounds potatoes (about 3 medium), cut into 1-inch cubes
instruction: 1. Sprinkle beef with salt and pepper; toss with flour. In a Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat; cook beef and onion until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Stir in curry powder, soy sauce, bay leaves, and stock; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, covered, 45 minutes.
2. Stir in potatoes and carrots; return to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, covered, until meat and vegetables are tender, 1¼ hours, stirring occasionally.
3. Remove bay leaves; stir in vinegar. If desired, serve with rice.

recipes.name: Poteca Nut Roll
recipes.description: A passed down recipe from Yugoslavia for a nice nut roll.
ingredients: 1 large egg, room temperature, lightly beaten
Filling (Butter, Sugar, Eggs, Vanilla Extract, lemon extract, walnuts, 2% milk)
instruction: 1. In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Add the milk, sugar, salt, egg, shortening, and 1½ cups flour; beat until smooth. Add enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.
2. Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, 6–8 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.

3. Punch down. Turn onto a lightly floured surface; roll into a 30x20-inch rectangle. In a bowl, combine the butter, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, lemon extract (if desired), and nuts. Stir in enough milk to achieve spreading consistency. Spread over the rectangle to within 1 inch of edges.

4. Roll up jelly-roll style, starting with a long side; pinch seams and ends to seal. Place on a greased baking sheet; shape into a tight spiral. Cover and let rise until nearly doubled, about 1 hour.
5. Bake at 350° until golden brown, about 35 minutes. Remove from pan to a wire rack to cool. If desired, combine confectioners' sugar and enough milk to make a thin glaze; brush over roll.

recipes.name: Beef Paprikash with Fire-Roasted Tomatoes
recipes.description: A Hungarian dish.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons sweet Hungarian or regular paprika, divided
2 pounds boneless beef chuck roast, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 small sweet red pepper, finely chopped
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) fire-roasted diced tomatoes, undrained
1 package (16 ounces) kluski or other egg noodles
instruction: 1. In a small bowl, mix flour, 1 tablespoon paprika, and ½ teaspoon salt. Sprinkle over beef and toss to coat; shake off excess.
2. In a Dutch oven, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Brown beef in batches, adding remaining oil as needed. Remove from pan with a slotted spoon, reserving drippings in the pan.

3. Add onion and pepper to drippings; cook and stir 4–5 minutes or until tender. Stir in tomato sauce, tomatoes, broth, and the remaining 1 tablespoon paprika and ¾ teaspoon salt; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, covered, until beef is tender, 1½–2 hours.
4. Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain; return to pot. Add butter and toss to coat. Serve with stew. If desired, sprinkle with parsley.

recipes.name: Shortbread
recipes.description: A simple recipe that comes from New Zealand.
instruction: 1. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Combine flour, cornstarch, and salt; gradually add to the creamed mixture and mix well. Roll dough into a 15x2x1-inch rectangle; chill.
2. Preheat oven to 325°. Cut into ¼-inch slices; place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Prick with a fork.
3. Bake 10–12 minutes or until set. Remove to wire racks to cool.

recipes.name: Thai Chicken Thighs
recipes.description: Tender and moist chicken thighs with peanut butter sauce.
ingredients: 8 bone-in chicken thighs (about 3 pounds), skin removed
instruction: 1. Place chicken in a 3-qt. slow cooker. In a small bowl, combine the salsa, peanut butter, lemon juice, soy sauce, jalapeno, Thai chili sauce, garlic, and ginger; pour over chicken.
2. Cook, covered, on low until chicken is tender, 5–6 hours.
3. Sprinkle with green onions and sesame seeds. Serve with rice if desired.
